Starting in a new position, in a new job is always a rollercoaster of emotions üé¢ a thrill of goodwill and a lot of thinking on ‚Äúplease don‚Äôt screw this‚Äù ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è any job! And most of times we could enter a startup, or a new project, but these projects could be already started, they can have an already built architecture üèó they made some decisions along the way and as engineers we should care about that, to know where and why we‚Äôre heading that way, we should care about history ü§ì This is a story on how the company where I work now used Python to handle its architecture and engineers to give service 41679 clients üî• some story on when to split apps, which framework we choose and why ü§î and some cover on important engineering topics like microservices, queueing, blocking operations and testing, oh yes, we have testing üßê Come and check out how to scale, or at least not die trying üöÄ
